definition: to defend against the cold/to keep warm
to resist/imperial/(classical) to drive (a chariot)/to manage/to govern

sentences.english: It is cold outside, take some warm clothes with you.
sentences.chinese: 外面很冷，带些御寒的衣服吧。

sentences.english: There are subsidized weatherizing services for low-income people as well.
sentences.chinese: 有政府资助的御寒低收入的服务，以及。

sentences.english: The soldiers were provided with overcoats against the cold.
sentences.chinese: 战士们都发了御寒的大衣。

sentences.english: Please bring enough clothes to keep you warm (the auditorium's air conditioning is strong).
sentences.chinese: 视听室冷气强，记得备妥御寒衣物。

sentences.english: Cold would not kill them off. "They just fluff their feathers," Townley told me.
sentences.chinese: 他还告诉我，小鸡不怕冷，“羽毛抖松就能御寒。”

sentences.english: They need winterized temporary shelters and blankets.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要能御寒的临时住所和毛毯。

sentences.english: In Prehistoric times, our ancestors in the Yellow River Delta started to spin and weave to cover their bodies from being cold.
sentences.chinese: 史前时期，黄河三角洲先民就为遮体御寒而纺线织布。

sentences.english: The summer, profession and non-warm clothing will be unaccepted.
sentences.chinese: 不接受夏季衣物，职业装及非御寒衣物。

sentences.english: One of two flaps attached to a cap to keep the ears warm.
sentences.chinese: 帽子上面两个可以护耳御寒的帽瓣。

sentences.english: Vitamin C is much more than just a tonic for resisting colds.
sentences.chinese: 维生素C决不仅仅是可以御寒的补药。

sentences.english: Have some hot soup to fortify you against the cold.
sentences.chinese: 喝一点热汤可以帮助你御寒。

sentences.english: He put on his coat and headed for the door.
sentences.chinese: 他穿上御寒的大衣冒雪外出。

sentences.english: Not to launch a car, several people hugged each other warm in the car.
sentences.chinese: 不发动车时，数人在车内彼此相拥御寒。

sentences.english: A rainproof parka provides protection against wet and cold weather.
sentences.chinese: 一件防雨派克衫可以御寒防潮。

sentences.english: It's an amalgam slightly disarmed by pastel-colored earmuffs , but Sean is still clearly not to be messed with.
sentences.chinese: 卸下淡彩色御寒耳罩，不过肖恩显然仍没有受到干扰。

sentences.english: Not even the thickest jacket was enough to keep out the cold.
sentences.chinese: 就连最厚的夹克也不足以御寒。

definition: to stay warm/to protect against the cold
to warm oneself/to expel the cold (TCM)
to escape the cold by going on a winter holiday
cold weather, frozen ground (idiom); bitterly cold
to warm oneself (by a fire etc)
